architecture-helper.summary: Massive velocity day. Direct DB pipeline eliminated Playwright - 30x faster building submissions.

items.text: Direct DB pipeline live: 9 buildings in 30 seconds (was 90s/building)
4 new European cities launched: Barcelona (15), Edinburgh (13), Bruges (16), Krak√≥w (17)
visible_in_library bug fixed - 77 buildings were hidden on Place pages
Typefully integration live - 18 drafts created, Barcelona thread already published
Daily content cron running (14:00 UTC) - auto-generates AH + CRE posts
PR #21 waiting for merge: map above tour, sticky sidebar, mobile bottom bar
Boston: 6 buildings still missing GPT analyses
Pinterest auto-posting 4x daily - 88 pins in queue (~22 days of content)
Must always set visible_in_library: true explicitly - save!(validate: false) skips defaults
X algorithm penalizes external links - rotate: 40% no link, 20% dot notation, 20% reply, 20% direct
Performance review cron runs every 3 days - checks Pinterest saves/clicks and X engagement, then adapts future content tone, format, and timing based on what performs
13 cities live, ~1105 buildings, 30 style pages, 13 PRs merged

plotzy.summary: Data acquisition strong. 10 cities, 120K zones. Zoning lookup could be a killer feature.

items.text: 10 cities acquired with ~120K zones, 566 MB total zoning data
Pipeline script: acquire.py with pagination, batch mode, point-in-polygon testing
Wave 1 next: Washington DC, Philadelphia, Boston
Nathan offered financial position context - advised broad strokes only for security
CRE OpenClaw SaaS plan: $99-799/mo tiers, Plotzy zoning data as moat
County assessor + ArcGIS zoning + municipal code = complete property zoning lookup from public sources
Houston has no zoning law. San Antonio too large (733K). Several cities lack public ArcGIS.
Potential killer feature: enter address ‚Üí instant zone + ordinance meaning
CA: LA/Sacramento/SF | TX: Austin/Dallas | FL: Tampa/Miami-Dade/Orlando/Ft Lauderdale | OK: Norman
